quote: Business emails, marketing and sales emails, personal emails.
writing an email to learn about something or writing an email to a friend.
I find that in my work, when I'm trying to interpret the results of research, the AI has not done the job very well.
It doesn't pick up on many of the themes in the research accurately, and it doesn't calculate data from an unstructured interview accurately either.

A perfect AI assistant would function much like a human, perhaps even faster and more efficiently, in anticipating my needs and being proactive in getting things done for me, both in personal and work-related matters.

an AI tool that could go through my calendar for the coming week, organize it for me, and prepare a memo of what I need to prepare. Essentially, it would create an agenda for what I have to prepare for each meeting coming up in the week based on my Outlook calendar.

For Excel, I'd like it to perform basic calculations when it comes to analyzing the research information we have. For PowerPoint, it would be ideal if it could transfer information from interview transcripts into a PowerPoint presentation. And with Word, it would be great if it could assist in writing first drafts of proposals.

I don't think, at this point, the interface would pull the depth of information that I'd be looking for that a person conducting interviews, particularly a well-experienced person, would be able to get from me.
This is especially true with the ability to go off script and know when to do so, as well as to follow the prompts of the person they're interviewing.

I think it's the ability to take the information that's provided and come up with an insightful follow-up. Not an obvious follow-up, but a more insightful follow-up to take the conversation to the next level.
